member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.AudioUtils.Log2ApproximationOrder5(System.Span{System.Single},System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Calculates the approximation of the binary logarithm for each element of using a 5th order polynomial and stores it in .
The maximum error in the range [1.0, 2.0) is:
1.4534581828540283E-05 without FMA
1.4488913925525537E-05 with FMA
The length of the and must be the same: if the is longer, the trailing extra element will be ignored; if the is longer, the trailing extra element will remain unchanged.
member.param: The place to store the approximation of the binary logarithm for each element of .
The values to calculate the approximation of the binary logarithm.

The value which indicates whether the can utilize Fused Multiply-Adds.
Polynomial computation using FMA yields different results than polynomial computation without FMA, but it can be faster without significantly increasing the average error.

member.name: M:Shamisen.Utils.AudioUtils.Log10ApproximationOrder5(System.Span{System.Single},System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Single},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Calculates the approximation of the decimal logarithm for each element of using a 5th order polynomial and stores it in .
The calculation is done by calculating binary logarithm with first, then multiplying the constant 0.3010299956639812f.
The length of the and must be the same: if the is longer, the trailing extra element will be ignored; if the is longer, the trailing extra element will remain unchanged.
member.param: The place to store the approximation of the decimal logarithm for each element of .
The values to calculate the approximation of the decimal logarithm.

The value which indicates whether the can utilize Fused Multiply-Adds.
Polynomial computation using FMA yields different results than polynomial computation without FMA, but it can be faster without significantly increasing the average error.

member.summary: Rounds a vector of single-precision floating-point value to the nearest integral values, and rounds midpoint values to the nearest even number.

Rounds a vector of single-precision floating-point value to the nearest integral values, and rounds midpoint values to the nearest even number.
This one is suitable for processing inside loops.
member.param: A vector of single-precision floating-point numbers to be rounded.
A broadcast vector with only sign bits set. If you pass wrong value, this function won't work as intended.
A broadcast vector represents 16777216f. If you pass wrong value, this function won't work as intended.
member.returns: The integer nearest . If the fractional component of is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then the even number is returned. Note that this method returns a floating-point instead of an integral .
